answers.question: What are the main ways to enter and stay in Romania?
answers.answer: You can enter Romania with temporary protection, with the right of short-stay, or as an asylum seeker. Ukrainian nationals with a valid passport can enter and stay for up to 90 days. You can also apply for asylum within Romania at a later point.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the page carefully.

answers.question: What kind of support services are offered to people?
answers.answer: Support services include food, clothing, personal hygiene products, primary and emergency health care, and free medical care for acute or chronic life-threatening diseases. Foreign nationals from the conflict zone also benefit from medical services, supplies, and medicines like insured Romanian citizens. Resources can also be requested via Sprijin de Urgență.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the sections under 'Social services', 'Medical assistance', and 'Sprijin de Urgență'.
answers.read_instruction: read the sections under 'Social services', 'Medical assistance', and 'Sprijin de Urgență'.

answers.question: How can someone get a job in Romania?
answers.answer: You have the right to work in Romania, even without temporary protection, by applying for a work permit at the General Inspectorate for Immigration. You may not need a work permit or visa if you provide a statement about your training/experience, unless you work in regulated liberal professions. For employment incentives, you can register with county employment agencies or the Bucharest municipality.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the section under 'Work'.

answers.question: How can people find a place to live?
answers.answer: There is currently no financial support for renting a home, but hosts of people from the conflict zone can be reimbursed for accommodation and food expenses. You can find support in finding temporary accommodation or offer a space through Un Acoperiș.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the sections under 'Accommodation' and 'Un Acoperiș'.
answers.read_instruction: read the sections under 'Accommodation' and 'Un Acoperiș'.

answers.question: What are the options for children to go to school?
answers.answer: Children and young refugees from Ukraine can enroll in the Romanian education system if they have legal residence in Romania, specifically benefiting from temporary protection or asylum.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the section under 'Education'.
